thread.title: Three Sindh players to go for International Club event
thread.title_full: Three Sindh players to go for International Club event

title: Three Sindh players to go for International Club event
text:
- Tuesday, October 20, 2015 - From Print Edition 
KARACHI: Three tennis players from Sindh will participate in the International Club’s Asia/Pacific Junior Challenge tournament to be held in Singapore from October 28-30. 

“Raza Sawani, Nauman Aftab and Hania Naveed will leave on the 26th to play this event. This is an under-16 event and the players will be taking part on self-finance basis,” said Pakistan Tennis Federation (PTF) secretary Khalid Rehmani. 

He added that the IC 16-and-under Junior Challenge began in 2005, open to all 40 ICs, for two girls and two boys with an adult captain. 

All juniors play a singles and a doubles match against other country teams with all matches counting towards one overall team result. 

A regional event is played in every continent and the winners of the regional events go through to play the World Finals the following year. 

International Club of Pakistan sent a group of four junior tennis players to take part in IC Junior Challenge (Asia/Oceania) in 2013 at Estolle Tennis Club and Hotel Tokyo, Japan. 

Australia, Japan, Singapore and Pakistan were the teams in Japan’s event. Pakistani team comprising Nazif Ahmed, Hasan Farooq, Raza Sawani, Muhammad Ibrahim, Kaoru Kisanuki and Mayu Hontama played its match against Singapore. IC took players to play an event in India in 2009 as well.
